info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 27 at 12:08AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Rock Island, northwestern Mercer, west central Whiteside, south central Jo Daviess, northwestern Carroll, northwestern Henry, Jackson, eastern Cedar, eastern Muscatine, northeastern Louisa, Scott, southeastern Jones and Clinton Counties through 1230 AM CST... At 1207 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wyoming to near Rochester to near Eliza. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Wyoming, Oxford Junction and Onslow around 1210 AM CST. Bennett and Monmouth around 1215 AM CST. Blue Grass, Andalusia, Wheatland, Reynolds, Taylor Ridge, Nashville, Montpelier and Hamlet around 1220 AM CST. Maquoketa, Milan, Buffalo, Grand Mound, Calamus, Oak Grove, Donahue, Fulton and Hurstville around 1225 AM CST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Moline, Rock Island, East Moline, Silvis, DeWitt, Coal Valley, Andrew, Riverdale, Welton and Springbrook. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 266 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 17. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 16. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
